message: anyone recommend a good tool/app that can help us organize our self?

data.message: What kind of organization are you talking about ? Time , Project , Resources ?
Time, Projects and Tasks. thing is for my personal use to manage my time perfectly.
for projects and tasks i recommend http://www.teamlab.com OR www.redmine.org ,TeamLab is written in ASP.NET while Redmine is written in Ruby but both work great for me
Waheed Sayed, what was the tool you use?
If this is on projects scale, then maybe Redmine, which is more of a complete tracker, if that's what you want. Other than that, then maybe any note taking application should do the job.

Mohamed Meligy sorry for late. I'm not sure what's exactly the case but i think Atlassian Jira (+ Greenhopper if you work Scrum) are good especially that you'll have free trial & cost is trivial if you decided to buy (I remember $10 for Jira & $20 Jira + Greenhopper)
Or Paradox or whatever, the thing that shows up when I interrupt your coding and we start talking :D

Ah sorry, It seem I didn't get the question right.. sorry it's Saturday :)
For time tracking there's a great tool call RescueTime but It's not following Pomodoro Technique (If I got u right).. There's another very simple tool call Focus Booster based on Pomodoro Technique

This is RescueTime (https://www.rescuetime.com/)
This is FocusBooster (http://www.focusboosterapp.com/)
Mohamed Alaa, try the tool RescueTime, FocusBooster, etc., maybe define activities per projects and so, it should help you a lot track your time for things you charge per hour. Thanks Waheed Sayed :)
Today I remembered another effective tool. It's Kanban board, so you can define projects & tasks and also has Pomodoro Timer to track time on tasks check https://kanbanflow.com
